google_reviews.review:
Everkept Construction - uses her as there listing agent
I spoke to Lynzi Cowden the listing agent and was asking questions about what options I could get that were not an extra fee, like color choices and cabinets etc. I also let her know I did not like the white cabinets they typically put in there homes and wanted to see if the builder would let me buy my own cabinets and have someone put them in and I understood they would not warrantee them. I had noticed that some of there floor plans had the entry way closet, pantry and linen closet but not all the plans had them all in one floor plan, that I had seen yet in the previouse mls listings. I was asking if they had a floor plan with all these things and her response was . ( These are spec homes. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR) was her exact words. She acted like my questions were an annoyance to her and that I was asking redicluose questions. She said that these spec houses don't come with those things , that's why we're selling them for such a low cost . Even though some of the so called spec houses did have these things. She said that would be a custom home which was confusing because they have plans that have these things in them already. She was texting with me part of the time and spoke to me once on the phone . I felt like she was downplaying the homes and felt that she was very immature and unprofessional. She was not catering to the client at all. I also asked when the lots that have a green belt behind them would be available and she replyed (whenever there ready, after we sell the others ). She wasnt concerned about helping me get what i wanted. I would have been a client and bought a home with cash no financing , but she ruined it for me . The house experience is supposed to be a fun one , picking colors , lot to build on etc., but not if I have to deal with someone who has a bad attitude and is downplaying the homes. I feel the builder should know and others to beware

google_reviews.author: Samantha Arias-Romero
google_reviews.review:
My husband and I recently started the rental process with Windermere. As we all do, I came to check their Google reviews and I was terrified. There is so many negative comments and one stars all over the place. (Not just Windermere but most management companies) The housing market in Bellingham keeps getting hard month after month it seems like.

Anyway my husband and I have had a pleasant time from the moment we called to check the availability to the moment we were approved. They were very professional and very helpful with the millions of questions I had. I believe there turn around time was fast, applied Friday was approved Wednesday. Turn around was just a few business days,

So far I am happy with the interactions I have had with this management company. If you are a perspective renter don't rely on the reviews on here. This is my review for the application process and how I was treated.

Thank you Windermere, keep up the good work.

summary.text:
Good

Windermere Real Estate - Whatcom, Inc. has received some positive feedback from users who appreciated their services during the rental process. One user mentioned a particularly smooth experience from the moment they inquired about availability to their approval as tenants, highlighting professional and helpful interactions throughout. This user emphasized the quick turnaround in application processing, which took just a few business days, suggesting that their customer service met expectations during this critical time in a challenging housing market.

Another user also expressed satisfaction with the professionalism of their representative, noting that they were held patiently until all documents were ready. This feedback provides reassuring insight for potential clients, suggesting that while the company may have its issues, there are also instances where the services meet or exceed the basic expectations, making the experience worthwhile for some clients.

Great

While overwhelmingly negative reviews dominate Windermere's feedback, a few users have had notably positive experiences, particularly with specific agents. Praise for individual realtors who demonstrated exceptional professionalism and responsiveness can be found, which indicates that some employees are effectively fulfilling their roles. Users described their agents as helpful guides through potentially challenging processes, reinforcing that there are capable individuals within the organization committed to client satisfaction.

The strong commendations for certain staff members suggest an inconsistency in the overall service quality but stand as a beacon for those who might be lucky enough to work with one of the more attentive agents. This illustrates that, while the company itself has received substantial criticism, the personal touch and effort of individual employees can lead to a greatly improved experience.

Bad

The negative experiences shared by users often highlight challenges related to communication and the handling of properties. A significant issue raised involves the difficulty in reaching representatives, with multiple users noting that calls frequently go unanswered, leading to frustration over unreturned voicemails. This lack of responsiveness can exacerbate maintenance concerns, leaving tenants feeling neglected when they are unable to receive timely assistance.

Additionally, users have reported issues regarding cleanliness and the state of properties upon move-in. One user described their apartment as unclean upon arrival, reflecting poorly on the company's maintenance and turnover processes. Such experiences highlight a more systemic problem with property management that could detract potential clients who prioritize both communication and well-maintained living conditions.

Ugly

Several reviews paint a dire picture of Windermere Real Estate - Whatcom, Inc., especially concerning ethics and professionalism. Users allege serious grievances regarding overcharges and misleading communication, particularly at move-out, where one tenant reported excessive charges for what they deemed normal wear and tear. This raised questions about the transparency of the company in their billing practices and the potential for clients to feel taken advantage of financially.

Moreover, unprofessional behavior exhibited by employees is frequently mentioned, with one reviewer recalling an encounter with a realtor who belittled their questions and concerns, making them feel unsupported. Such accounts foster an image of a company that not only struggles with operational issues but appears to lack a foundational commitment to ethical and respectful client interactions, ultimately tarnishing its reputation within the community.
